triplets: Food made from flour, water, yeast, and other ingredients, typically baked
Eating as a staple food, making sandwiches, toasting, and cooking
Wheat flour, yeast, water, salt; may include sugar, milk, eggs, and seeds depending on type
Crust, the outer baked layer providing texture and flavor
Crumb, the soft inner portion of the bread
Varies depending on flour type and baking; common colors include white, brown, golden, or multigrain
Bakery products, staple diet, breakfast and snack items
Various bakeries and commercial bread producers
Typically 200–1000 grams depending on loaf size
Approximately 5–15 cm depending on loaf type
Typically 2–7 days depending on storage and bread type; longer if frozen or preserved
